VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-01] Re-entrancy bug allows inflating balance
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: An attacker can call the function with a fake contract disguised as a token pair and return fake reserves that yield more tokens than expected. This allows the attacker to be credited multiples of the actual swap result and steal all tokens. The vulnerability can be repeated many times. The function is vulnerable to several attack vectors as the attacker controls many parameters.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Adding re-entrancy guards (from OpenZeppelin) to all external functions of MarginRouter. Consider removing the estimation and only doing the actual trade first, then calling registerTrade with the actual trade amounts returned.

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-02] Missing  fromToken != toToken  check
VulnerabilityDesc.Location: Missing fromToken != toToken check in MarginRouter.crossSwapExactTokensForTokens function
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Attacker can call the function with a fake pair and the same token[0] == token[1], and return fake reserves that yield 0 output. This allows the attacker to send funds to a fake contract and pass all checks in _swap call that follows, circumventing the time-lock. The full impact is not yet known as registerTrade could still fail when subtracting the inAmount and adding 0 outAmount.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Check fromToken != toToken to prevent cyclical trades (arbitrages)

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-03] No entry checks in crossSwap[Exact
VulnerabilityDesc.Location: crossSwapTokensForExactTokens and crossSwapExactTokensForTokens functions of MarginRouter.sol
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Calling these functions allow the caller to trade on behalf of marginswap, which could result in losing funds. It's possible to construct all parameters to circumvent the checks. Also, the 'pairs' can be fully specified, which are contract addresses that are called from getAmountsIn / getAmountsOut and from pair.swap. This way you can call arbitrary (self-constructed) code, which can reentrantly call the marginswap code.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Limiting who can call the functions, whitelisting contents of pairs and tokens, and checking the size of pairs and tokens is the same

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-03] Price feed can be manipulated
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Wrong prices break the core functionality of the contracts such as borrowing on margin, liquidations, etc.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Implementing a TWAP price oracle using the price*CumulativeLast variables instead of Uniswap spot price

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-04] Inconsistent usage of  applyInterest
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The function applyInterest is unclear if it is supposed to return a new balance with the interest applied or only the accrued interest, leading to misbehaving code and incorrect values for balance and accrued interest.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Make consistent in all cases when calling this function

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-07]  account.holdsToken  is never set
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The addHolding function does not update the account.holdsToken map, leading to a critical vulnerability where deposits of the same token keep being pushed to the account.holdingTokens array but the sum is correctly updated in account.holdings[token]. This allows an attacker to deposit the same token multiple times, which increases their balance by multiple times the actual value. This inflated balance can then be withdrawn to steal all tokens.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Set account.holdsToken map in addHolding function

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-10] function buyBond charges msg.sender twice
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The function buyBond charges msg.sender twice by transferring the amount from msg.sender twice.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add a check to ensure that the transfer is only executed once

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-11] Impossible to call withdrawReward fails due to run out of gas
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The withdrawReward function fails due to an unbounded array and an uninitialized variable, which can cause the function to run out of gas. The issue can be resolved partially by initializing the lastUpdatedDay variable. However, the design should be rethought to avoid unbounded arrays and gas limit issues.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Initialize lastUpdatedDay variable to resolve the issue partially and rethink the design to avoid unbounded array and gas limit issues

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-06] Users Can Drain Funds From MarginSwap By Making Undercollateralized Borrows If The Price Of A Token Has Moved More Than 10% Since The Last MarginSwap Borrow/Liquidation Involving Accounts Holding That Token.
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: MarginSwap's internal price oracle is only updated for a particular token if a borrow or liquidation is attempted for an account that is lending/borrowing that particular token. For a less popular token, the price could move quite a bit without any borrow or liquidation being called on any account lending/borrowing that token, especially if MarginSwap does not end up being wildly popular, or if it supports lesser-known assets. The various defenses that MarginSwap has employed against undercollateralized loans are all bypassed.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Use UniswapV2/SushiSwap/UniswapV3's built-in TWAP price oracle

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-09] Isolated margin contracts declare but do not set the value of liquidationThresholdPercent
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Isolated margin contracts declare but do not set the value of liquidationThresholdPercent
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Set the initial value for the liquidationThresholdPercent in Isolated margin contracts

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-05] Wrong liquidation logic
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The inequality in the last equation is wrong, leading to wrong liquidation decisions. Users that shouldn't be liquidated can be liquidated, and users that should be liquidated cannot get liquidated.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the inequality in the last equation to return 100 * holdings <= liquidationThresholdPercent * loan;

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-06] Users are credited more tokens when paying back debt with  registerTradeAndBorrow
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Users are credited more tokens when paying back debt with registerTradeAndBorrow function, allowing them to make a profit of one outAmount by withdrawing and repeating the process until the funds are empty.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Update the adjustAmounts function to only credit 'outAmount extinguishableDebt' as a deposit like in registerDeposit function.

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-08] Rewards cannot be withdrawn
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Rewards cannot be withdrawn as msg.sender is enforced to be the incentive reporter and can therefore not be the margin trader.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Remove the isIncentiveReporter(msg.sender) check from withdrawReward function

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [H-09] lastUpdatedDay not initialized
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The variable lastUpdatedDay is not properly initialized, leading to a very large loop and out of gas error. If the loop would stop, the variable currentDailyDistribution is not accurate, resulting in a far lower incentive distribution than expected.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Initialize lastUpdatedDay variable with a value like block.timestamp / (1 days)

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-01] No default  liquidationThresholdPercent
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: No default liquidationThresholdPercent which means it is set to 0. The belowMaintenanceThreshold function uses this value and anyone could be liquidated due to 100 * holdings = liquidationThresholdPercent * loan = 0 being always true. Anyone can be liquidated immediately. If the faulty belowMaintenanceThreshold function is fixed (see other issue), then nobody could be liquidated which is bad as well.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Set a default liquidation threshold like in CrossMarginTrading contracts

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-02] Missing checks if pairs equal tokens
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: It's easy to set faulty liquidation paths which then end up reverting the liquidation transactions.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Check that path.length + 1 == tokens.length and that the tokens match the pair

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-04] maintainer can be pushed out
VulnerabilityDesc.Location: liquidate function in CrossMarginLiquidation.sol and IsolatedMarginLiquidation.sol
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: An attacker can repeatedly call the liquidate function and push out the maintainer, taking over the liquidation revenues.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Put authorization on who can call the liquidate function, review the maintainer punishment scheme.

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-05] Several function have no entry check
VulnerabilityDesc.Location: Several functions in Lending.sol, Admin.sol, CrossMarginLiquidation.sol, IsolatedMarginLiquidation.sol, and PriceAware.sol
VulnerabilityDesc.Type: No entry check or trivial entry check
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Manipulating input values (e.g. extremely large values) could disturb the internal administration of the contract, potentially locking functions or giving wrong rates. The 'haircut' function has a trivial guard but may need an extra guard to ensure it's an isolated margin trading contract.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add entry checks if necessary and add a comment to notify the function is meant to be called by everyone

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-07] diffMaxMinRuntime gets default value of 0
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: diffMaxMinRuntime variable is never set nor updated so it gets a default value of 0, making the calculations that use it either always return 0 (when multiplying) or fail (when dividing) when calculating bucket indexes or sizes.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Set appropriate value for diffMaxMinRuntime and update it whenever min or max runtime variables change

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-08] PriceAware uses prices from getAmountsOut
VulnerabilityDesc.Type: Manipulation of values returned from getAmountsOut
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The impact of the vulnerability is reduced with UPDATE_MIN_PEG_AMOUNT and UPDATE_MAX_PEG_AMOUNT, however, it is not entirely eliminated.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Using Uniswap v2 TWAP oracle or implementing UPDATE_MIN_PEG_AMOUNT and UPDATE_MAX_PEG_AMOUNT

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-10] Add a timelock to functions that set key variables
VulnerabilityDesc.Location: Functions like setLeveragePercent and setLiquidationThresholdPercent for both IsolatedMarginTrading and CrossMarginTrading contracts
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The owner could call the functions whenever they want and a position could become liquidable from one block to the other.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Add a timelock to the functions
